p: It has been recently discovered that B. ligulata exhibit an insecticidal property. The volatile oil from roots of B. ligulata containing 1,8-cineole ( 119) [4.24%], (+)-(6 S)-isovaleric acid ( 120) [6.25%], (+)-(6 S)-parasorbic acid ( 121) [47.45%], terpinen-4-ol ( 122) [2.96%], and ( Z)-asarone ( 123) [3.50%] was tested for its insecticidal activity against Drosophila melanogaster, which was found to be significant [ 109]. Thus, volatile oil from Bergenia species or its specific component could be deployed as a natural insecticidal agent [ 24, 109].
